title: Bison face Southwestern Saturday
text: Posted Oct. 23, 2015 at 4:00 AM Posted Oct. 23, 2015 at 4:00 AM Oklahoma Baptist, fresh off its first road win in NCAA, tries for its first win streak Saturday at noon when Southwestern Oklahoma State visits Crain Family Stadium. The Bison are 10-7-2 all-time against Southwestern Oklahoma State. OBU won the last meeting, in 1940, 20-0 to stretch OBU’s unbeaten streak in that series to five games. OBU had three shutouts in that streak. The Bulldogs are coached by former Chandler High School mentor Dan Cocannouer, who is 25-47 in 6-plus seasons with Southwestern. The Bulldogs are 4-3 and on a two-game win streak in which they have averaged 55 points per game. D.J. Jones leads the GAC in All-Purpose yards with 158 per game. The Bulldogs whipped Southern Nazarene 73-7 in a game with zero turnovers last week. It was a balanced attack for SWOSU with 344 yards in the air and 315 on the ground. Kedron Banks ran for 144 yards and Marc Evans added 325 through the air, hitting D.J. Jones for three touchdowns and 98 yards. Marc Evans leads the Bulldogs with 297 yards passing per game with 16 touchdowns and seven interceptions. The big targets this year have been D.J. Jones with 27 catches and 78 yards per game and JR Imigie with 24 catches. Leading the running game has been Kartrell Hende with 59 yards per game and seven touchdowns. The Bison counter with GAC Defensive Player of the Week Brynden Pitzer (4.5 sacks, 3 interceptions), Zach Bishop (8.7 tackles per game), and D’Ante Meeking (four interceptions). The Bison won 41-38 at Northwestern after trailing 24-0 late in the second quarter. OBU turned in two defensive touchdowns and got 211 yards rushing in the second half by Jacob Ellis. Oklahoma Baptist, with all its injuries in the secondary, leads the Great American Conference with interceptions returned for touchdowns. OBU has taken three passes back to the end zone this season. Brynden Pitzer’s two TD returns is tied for the NCAA Division II lead and D’Ante Meeking’s four interceptions is 19th in Division II. Jacob Ellis set a school record with 211 yards rushing last week at Northwestern. Dez Stegall leads the team this season with 475 yards passing. Top receivers have been Stephan Turner with 27 catches and Derek Serowski with 226 yards receiving. Defensive back Conner Bays leads teh Bulldogs with 77 tackles. Bays shares the interceptions lead on the team with Kapena Olson, each with two. Collier Ward leads the squad with two sacks. The Massey Ratings have Southwestern Oklahoma State winning this one, 31-28. The Shawnee News-Star
